body:
I installed spack on my home directory which is on a NFS. The NFS is shared by several HPC clusters. When I install packages on a cluster, it turns out it can be used by another cluster which has different OS version, eg, CentOS6 vs. CentOS7 in my case.

I have no clues how to deal with it. Can someone give me a hint or point me to the documentation?

By the way, the error messages are:
> ==> Error: No compilers found for operating system centos6 and target x86_64.
> If previous installations have succeeded, the operating system may have been updated.
> Compilers are defined for the following operating systems and targets:
>         centos7-x86_64
title: spack on NFS
